candidates.title: Update diesel_async to remove some unneeded dbg calls and hopefully fix the mysql metrics run
Improved error messages
candidates.body:
This should likely be reviewed on commit bases, as 
28f5e43  updates the compiler version used for our compile tests (which changes ~all the error messages).
Checkout 8558d53 and https://github.com/weiznich/rust-foundation-community-grant/blob/83fd28b310b7f33a630cb851f7fd8a5cc610d3fc/test_cases/tests/diesel/bad_sql_query.stderr for examples of the improved error messages.

candidates.title: Generalize `FromSql` impls for the Mysql backend
candidates.body:
This commit generalizes the `FromSql` impl for `Text` and `Bytea` to use
a pointer type instead of `String` and `Vec<u8>` to closely mirror the
implementation of the postgresql backend. This simplifies how other
crates can abstract over a fundamental set of diesel types.

candidates.title: Bump chrono to 0.4.20 and remove deprecated code usage
candidates.body: I've opted for removing support for 0.4.19 instead of just allowing the deprecated constant as we haven't released 2.0 yet and so it's easier to support future versions.

candidates.title: Prepare 2.0 release
candidates.body:
I would like to propose cutting a final 2.0.0 release on 11 August 2022

In addition to everything included in this PR (and what's already on the 2.0.x branch) I would like to include the following PR's as well:

* #3254 (Crates.io using this pattern is a good reason for me to fix this on our side)
* #3257 (To unblock publishing the firebird custom backend)
* #3258 (This is only a minor bugfix)

candidates.title: Update some dependencies for `diesel_bench`
candidates.body:
* Sqlx to 0.6
* SeaORM to 0.9
* Reenable diesel_async with diesel 2.0.0-rc.1 support

candidates.title: Improve the CI workflows
candidates.body:
* remove unmaintained actions-rs actions where possible (everywhere
beside of the audit check)
* Improve the minimal supported rust version check to follow that what
other crates do
* Update clippy/rustfmt to stable we want to switch to the current
stable rust-toolchain locally

candidates.title: Add `Timestamptz` support for the `time` crate v0.3, to Diesel's 2.0 branch
Updated ipnetwork to 0.20
candidates.body: This PR updates the ipnetwork dependency to also allow ipnetwork 0.20.

candidates.title: `ipnet-address` feature, providing conversions to/from the `ipnet` crate
candidates.body:
NOTE: this is one possible prototype of https://github.com/diesel-rs/diesel/discussions/3164

Details:
- This adds an `ipnet-address` feature, which acts exactly like `network-address`, but using the `ipnet` crate instead of `ipnetwork`.
- This copies a fair amount of code that is also in-use by `network-address`, but allows the features to remain functional simultaneously.

candidates.title: Allow `DISTINCT ON` to be used with queries containing an explicit sort order
candidates.body: This fixes the issue reported here: https://github.com/diesel-rs/diesel/discussions/3144#discussioncomment-2658922

candidates.title: Add like, not_like and concat for PostgreSQL Bytea
candidates.body:
I saw a couple of issues requestinhg support for this (e.g. #3127).

This is mostly a copy of `TextExpressionMethods`.

Would love to know if there's a more concise way of creating a `Vec<u8>` from a readable literal other than `"S%".as_bytes().to_owned())`.

candidates.title: Reduced the required dependencies for diesel_dynamic_schema
candidates.body: Now that we have the `postgres_backend` and `mysql_backend` features (would it make sense to also have the `sqlite_backend` feature?), I think it should be possible to use these dependencies so that we don't need to compile the system features. This can reduce compilation time of crates that provide their own PostgreSQL and MySQL connections (such as the new async connections).

candidates.title: Update dependencies for 2.0
candidates.body: This PR updates two outdated dependencies to their newer version. As both are internal to diesel, that does not require any additional work

candidates.title: Bench updates
candidates.body:
* Fix the diesel_async benchmarks
* Bump some dependencies
* Use batch inserts for all crates supporting sqlite so that this is a fair benchmark

candidates.title: Bump the diesel_async version to fix the metrics job
Benchmarks with instruction counts

labels.name: run-benchmarks
labels.description: Used to indicate that github actions should run our benchmark suite

candidates.body: Hopefully this works also on the CI, otherwise this is only an option for local runs.

candidates.title: Enable expressions on the left-hand side of update.set()
candidates.body:
It looks like there are a bunch of strategies one can use to implement this behaviour

```
diesel::update(my_table::table).set(array_col.index(1).eq(true))
```

My line of reasoning is -

- There should be a trait between `Column` and `Assign` which `Column` implements which reduces to the current implementation
- This allows the definition of `AssignmentTarget` for arbitrary types which will be picked up by the `AsChangeset` `impl`.

I hit a wall updating the definition for `AsChangeset` as I have an unbounded type parameter (changset.rs:44). I was exploring a few workarounds but none that made me particularly happy.

Would be great to know your thoughts on this direction and whether it's possible to complete this implementation without something heavy like introducing a new param to `AsChangeset`.

candidates.title: Switch from dotenv to dotenvy
candidates.body: Unfortunately dotenv isn't maintained anymore (last commit 2 years ago). That's why [dotenvy](https://github.com/allan2/dotenvy) was created. It's a well maintained fork or the original dotenv.

candidates.title: Fix clap 3.1 deprecation warnings in Diesel CLI
candidates.body:
Those would prevent from compiling at all due to `#![deny(warnings)]`.
Also tests broke due to an error message update.
